body.p: Your note came to hand, during my absence from home. I hasten to reply without consultation with any friends, as I expect to leave for Ohio on the morning train.

You are in the right place to work for ^James^ Ammerman. He is committed for trial at the April term of the Court. He is certainly guilty of forgery and will go to the Penitentiary, unless the Gov. Bramlette will pardon him. I understand that he is willing to go into the Army, if he can escape imprisonment.
none of the parties will interpose any objection, and if I were at home I could get them to petition the Gov. to that effect.
So get Gov. B. to interpose in his behalf before the trial, and take him into the battery.
I go to Ohio, to purchase a home for Joel.

Bourbon Cir Ct
